model.forecasting_baselines module¶

class model.forecasting_baselines.BaselineBase(whole_series, target_column)¶

Bases: model.forecasting_interface.ForecastingModelInterface

eval(test_data_df, horizon_length)¶
Parameters

  • test_data_df –

  • horizon_length –

Returns

list of forecasts for each forecast point in the given test_data_df. Each forecast is of length horizon_length

fit(train_data)¶

Fit the model on the given data

Parameters

train_data_df –

property series¶
class model.forecasting_baselines.MovingAverage(window_size, whole_series: Optional[pandas.core.series.Series] = None, target_column=None)¶

Bases: model.forecasting_baselines.BaselineBase

Forecasted value is the moving average of a sliding window. For longer horizons (larger than window_size) the sliding window calculates the moving average of previously calculated averages

forecast(horizon_size, forecast_point_index, dynamic=True, index_or_label=False)¶
Parameters

  • horizon_size – size of the forecasting horizon

  • forecast_point_index – index after which the forecasting will begin

  • dynamic – True for true forecasts,

  • index_or_label – False to use the integer index of the series, True to use actual index (For example datetime if the series has a DateTimeIndex)

Returns

series containing the forecasts indexed by the same index of the original series

property name¶
Returns

Name of the given model identified by some of its hyperparameters or a predetermined name

class model.forecasting_baselines.Naive(whole_series: Optional[pandas.core.series.Series] = None, target_column=None)¶

Bases: model.forecasting_baselines.BaselineBase

Simply returns the last know value as the prediction for the whole horizon

forecast(horizon_size, forecast_point_index, dynamic=True, index_or_label=False)¶
Parameters

  • horizon_size – size of the forecasting horizon

  • forecast_point_index – index after which the forecasting will begin

  • dynamic – True for true forecasts,

  • index_or_label – False to use the integer index of the series, True to use actual index (For example datetime if the series has a DateTimeIndex)

Returns

series containing the forecasts indexed by the same index of the original series

Returns

Name of the given model identified by some of its hyperparameters or a predetermined name

class model.forecasting_baselines.NaiveSeasonal(seasonal_period, whole_series: Optional[pandas.core.series.Series] = None, target_column=None)¶

Bases: model.forecasting_baselines.BaselineBase

Forecasted value is the value before seasonal_period of the currently forecasted index

forecast(horizon_size, forecast_point_index, dynamic=True, index_or_label=False)¶
